data.title: Panel dock position is not saved or loaded
data.body:
I changed panel(Scene, FileSystem, Inspector) position and close editor.
when open project again, all settings go default.

tested with 0ed864d876347841d60797773a37c0b2f235c85c on Unbuntu 14.04 and Windows 7

And Settings > Editor Layout > Save Layout > Save button doesn't work also.
I don't know what this for, I can see just save, delete & default. no load.

data.title: Quit to Project List is not triggered when press Alt > Shift > Q on Windows
data.body:
I guess both case should work.

<kbd>Shift</kbd> > <kbd>Alt</kbd> > <kbd>Q</kbd> => fine
<kbd>Alt</kbd> > <kbd>Shift</kbd> > <kbd>Q</kbd> => doesn't work

data.title: Update copyright to 2016 in headers
rigidbody(3D) ignoring scale parameters while running.
data.body: If you create a rigidbody and change it's scale settings, the size in the editor changes appropriately. When you test your game however, the scale is still 1:1:1 in the game world.

data.title: Kinematicbody not colliding with staticbody
data.body: I'm working on a camera raycasting demo for 3d found here: https://github.com/oxrock/Godot-camera-raycasting-demo and ran into the problem of collision not behaving as expected. I can simply change the staticbody node type to rigidbody and collision with the player(kinematicbody) starts working. If I change it back to staticbody, collisions stop again.

data.title: autoload singleton error in editor
data.body:
It seems to work fine.
But console says errors when opening project.

![singleton](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8281454/12069808/1aa92156-b091-11e5-9e61-f02a5abbe9b6.jpg)

```
   At: res://test.gd:5
ERROR: reload: Method/Function Failed, returning: ERR_COMPILATION_FAILED

```

data.title: Updated copyright to 2016
Project Setting : Render : default_clear_color
data.body:
hello,

i have trying the last build "December 31, 2015 at 14:37"

I have changed the Project Setting : Render : default_clear_color
and now, godot don't show my project in the project list .

It hate the default_clear_color value in the engine.cfg of my project.

i have this error: "engine.cfg:22 error: Expected value, got ERROR."
At core/io/config_file.cpp:180

```
[render]

default_clear_color=#FF000000
```

data.title: Project name is shown as "Unnamed Project" at Project Manager
data.body:
I tested with 586e482a98702055ed7323a3e81c14392233b650 commit.

engine.cfg file sample is here.

```
[android]
modules="com/android/godot/GodotPaymentV3"

[application]
name="NewProjTest"
icon="res://icon.png"
```

if I move `android` section down below `application` section, it's fine.

data.title: Can not add new category at Project Settings
data.body:
AFAIK, I need to add `android` category with `modules` property to use android java module.
I tested with 586e482a98702055ed7323a3e81c14392233b650 commit.

steps to reproduce
1. open Project Settings
2. fill `Category : android`, `Property : modules` and set `Type : string`
3. nothing happened after clicked Add button.

data.title: Project is gone at project manager
data.body:
I tested with 586e482a98702055ed7323a3e81c14392233b650 commit.

steps to reproduce.
1. open project manager
2. create new project
3. check `Render > default_clear_color` at Project Settings.
4. Quit to Project List

then it's gone. and can't import either.

data.title: Creating/Adding project in Project Manager don't work
data.body:
In the latest b60a3e72028349493effe26811725d420c7e125b commit it's impossible to create or add new project. In case of creating project the files are created on the hard drive (engine.cfg is there) but it's impossible to import this project so as to it is visible on the project list. 
It's still possible to open projects created in this commit with older Godot.

data.title: Link Node (similar to Linux soft/hard links)
data.body:
I found that in many situations I could have benefit from having some kind of link node, similar to 'link' concept on Unix systems. There could be 2 kind of links soft and hard one (or some checkbox). 
Basically after adding link node to the scene you could define node to which they are linked to.
From this moment you could thread link as this linked target node (exactly just like it would be added instead of the link in this place, so you could call functions, add new nodes, remove child etc).

Difference between hard and soft links:
**Hard Link:** If you will use hard link and you will remove original node from the game it would still be accessible via hard link (probably should simply replace one of hard links)
**Soft Link:** If you remove original node from the game it's no longer accessible via soft links (not sure what exactly should happen, remove all soft links as well? Should be some way to change 'target' node for soft link in this situation instead (probably with signal)). 

In this comment I'm telling about use case where this can be helpful: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3174#issuecomment-170865934

data.title: Physics2D / default_gravity displaying value when unchecked
data.body:
When left unchecked, the value of 98.000000 is displayed in the debug console (the one that lives in its own window in OS Windows).

This is the setting found in Project Settings -> Physics2D -> default_gravity

data.title: Ability to view 3D RayCasts while running the game
data.body: The ability to view 3D RayCasts while running the game would be helpful for debugging.

data.title: Godot crashes on recent build
data.body:
I've been experiencing some serious weirdness since rebuilding godot.  I last built it a week ago and everything was fine.  I am on arch linux if that matters.

Godot starts with these errors but does not crash.  I don't know if they are related or not:

```
ERROR: get_edited_scene_root: Index current_edited_scene out of size (edited_scene.size()).
   At: tools/editor/editor_data.cpp:598.
ERROR: get_edited_scene_root: Index current_edited_scene out of size (edited_scene.size()).
   At: tools/editor/editor_data.cpp:598.
ERROR: add_child: Can't add child, already has a parent
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:740.
ERROR: add_child: Can't add child, already has a parent
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:740.
bind toptions
ERROR: get_edited_scene_root: Index current_edited_scene out of size (edited_scene.size()).
   At: tools/editor/editor_data.cpp:598.
ERROR: grab_focus: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true.
   At: scene/gui/control.cpp:2223.
ERROR: grab_focus: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true.
   At: scene/gui/control.cpp:2223.
```

When I try to open my main scene (which is pretty big and has many references to other scenes) godot crashes with the following error:

```
ERROR: set_current_tab: Index p_current out of size (get_tab_count()).
   At: scene/gui/tabs.cpp:625.
```

But it gets weirder.  When I opened my scripts folder in the filesystem tab, godot crashed (with the same "Index p_current out of size" error).  Opening other folders worked fine, but it crashed without fail when I opened the scripts folder.  However, I removed the contents of the scripts folder, then slowly added them back in (refreshing the filesystem tab as I went).  Throughout the process godot never crashed.  And it no longer crashed when I open the scripts folder.  This "fix" persisted even when I reopened godot.

Weird right?

data.title: added missing onready allocation for subclasses
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3158

The problem was with https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/30c12297dc6df7d35df140475c0cec7308aea77a. While gd_parser allocated the container for p_class->ready in the main classes, it didn't do so for subclasses.

data.title: Godot still crashes with empty concave polygon shape
data.body:
Hello!
I am using latest Godot 2.0 build on windows 7, and there is a bug: Godot crashes when it's loading scene with empty concave polygon shape. Exactly same issue was closed: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1709. Maybe those fixes were not included in build?

data.title: Code helper tooltip misses base functions on script extending
data.body:
If you extend script file, code helper won't show you inherited functions/variables
![issue](https://i.imgur.com/4UVLdOm.png)

data.title: draw_texture_rect third argument (bool tile) not applied
data.body:
This was reported by someone else on IRC, but I can confirm it's misbehaving.
If you use something like draw_texture_rect(mytexture, myrect, true) with a texture loaded from (at least in my test) a non-converted png file, it will stretch the texture as if it was false.

data.title: Build broken for Android and iOS after 45ad1024
data.body:
45ad1024e12ffa6db0e56cb36c007dd212d5e37e broke Android and iPhone builds.

```
scene/gui/popup.cpp: In member function 'void Popup::_notification(int)':
scene/gui/popup.cpp:51:51: error: 'class SceneTree' has no member named 'get_edited_scene_root'
   if (get_tree()->is_editor_hint() && get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root() && get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root()->is_a_parent_of(this)) {
                                                   ^
scene/gui/popup.cpp:51:90: error: 'class SceneTree' has no member named 'get_edited_scene_root'
   if (get_tree()->is_editor_hint() && get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root() && get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root()->is_a_parent_of(this)) {
```

Proof Android -  https://travis-ci.org/Marqin/godot/jobs/99270065#L6892
Proof iOS - https://travis-ci.org/Marqin/godot/jobs/99270067#L8229

data.title: Enhance debugging, new type of breakpoints
data.body:
I know I am stretching it, but it would be great if the users would be able to create a
breakpoint by clicking the area left to line numbers by making it a few pixels wider
(similar to Visual Studio), also adding a context menu to create custom breakpoint
that occurs when a condition is true, for example (only do a breakpoint if x value > 30)
Also, toggling the breakpoint should be easy as clicking..

data.title: Add more image file formats
data.body:
There is an awesome library called "stb_image" https://github.com/nothings/stb
It is a single header library, no license at all, can be used without any creditation.
Basically they are Public Domain, it has great number of file formats.

There are other header files too in that project to open OggVorbis, TrueType fonts...etc
also public domain.

Please consider adding more image formats, a vectorized SWF file would be awesome.
To avoid pixelated images while zooming. although it is not part of `stb_image` library.

data.title: Renaming anything in Godot should rename their references
data.body:
When renaming any kind of object in Godot, it should find all occurrences in scripts/editor
and change that as well. This can be achieved by parsing script files, any matching names for the changed scene/node, like "load(), preload(), set_script() get_node()..etc!) functions.

This should apply too to renaming variables, it would be great if when renaming a variable in script
it changes all occurrences in the script file.

data.title: Adding project heirarchichal view mode to related scenes
data.body:
Add a viewer to Project's root node hierarchical relationship to all referenced nodes in the project. When the project grows, finding the relationship between scenes becomes awkward and hard to maintain. By adding a Project mode, "Scene" like tab to show heirarchy of the object (a ListTree would suffice). It would make working with Godot more robust than ever.

In the Instancing wiki tutorial: see the following image.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/images/shooter_instancing.png

If Godot can show this kind of relationship between scenes it would be awesome.

I am coming from Game Maker Studio Pro, and I really hate to compare it with Godot since both
are excellent, and both have different ways of doing the management. But at least Game Maker Studio
does have excellent project viewer. It even creates logical filter "Folders" for resources or Rooms (Scenes) in the Project's ListTree.

Please consider adding this feature.

data.title: Enhancing Godot Engine :)
data.body:
- Add a viewer to Project's root node hierarchical relationship to all referenced nodes in the project.
  When the project grows, finding the relationship between scenes becomes awkward and hard to maintain.
  By adding a Project mode, "Scene" like tab to show heirarchy of the object (a ListTree would suffice).
  It would make working with Godot more robust than ever.

In the Instancing wiki tutorial: see the following image.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/wiki/images/shooter_instancing.png

If Godot can show this kind of relationship between scenes it would be awesome.

I am coming from Game Maker Studio Pro, and I really hate to compare it with Godot since both
are excellent, and both have different ways of doing the management. But at least Game Maker Studio
does have excellent project viewer. It even creates logical filter "Folders" for resources or Rooms (Scenes) in the Project's ListTree.

Please consider adding this feature.
- When renaming any kind of object in Godot, it should find all occurrences in scripts/editor
  and change that as well. This can be achieved by parsing script files, any matching names for the changed 
  scene/node, like "load(), preload(), set_script() get_node()..etc!) functions.
- There is an awesome library called "stb_image" https://github.com/nothings/stb
  It is a single header library, no license at all, can be used without any creditation.
  Basically they are Public Domain, it has great number of file formats.

There are other header files too in that project to open OggVorbis, TrueType fonts...etc
also public domain.
- Please consider adding more image formats, a vectorized SWF file would be awesome.
  To avoid pixelated images while zooming.
- I know I am stretching it, but it would be great if the users would be able to create a
  breakpoint by clicking  the area left to line numbers by making it a few pixels wider 
  (similar to Visual Studio), also adding a context menu to create custom breakpoint 
  that occurs when a condition is true, for example (only do a breakpoint `if x value > 30`)

Thanks for the great work on Godot, you guys are awesome.

data.title: Ability to use additive/substractive synthesis in Sprite/TextureFrame
data.body:
Currently, you can only use "mix"-style lighting for 2D Sprite and TextureFrame. It doesn't appear to be possible to use "add" or "sub" (additive/substractive) synthesis for those nodes, without making your own shader.

Like for 3D materials, there could be an option to have additive or substractive synthesis for Sprite and TextureFrame (if possible). This would allow for nicer vignette effects or damage screens.

data.title: Add tab close icon to the default theme
data.body: I noticed it after #3140. There is no `set_tab_close_display_policy(CloseButtonDisplayPolicy p_cb_displaypolicy)` bind for GDScript, but I guess it could be added at some point (the _tab_close_ signal and the policy constants are already bound).

data.title: Instant segfault when parsing subclass
data.body:
As of commit 4028dfa, a subclass present in a singleton causes an instant, non-informative segmentation fault running a project or opening the editor.
Running gdb only returns 

```
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x000000000049620c in GDCompiler::_parse_class(GDScript*, GDScript*, GDParser::ClassNode const*) ()
```

on an Ubuntu 15.10 64b system. gcc (Ubuntu 5.2.1-22ubuntu2) 5.2.1 20151010.

The class in question is merely 

```
class Char:
    var stats = {
        vital = 0,
        ep = 0,
        over = 0,
        ad = 0,
        lp = 0
    }
```

and removing/commenting it starts godot normally. (_This used to work until this commit_). 
I don't know if this is a behavior unique to singletons or a general problem in the class parser, though, I don't have any example of subclasses elsewhere.

data.title: export not working anymore(Master)
data.body:
Somehow export doesn't work anymore.

Example:
export var some_int = 0

parse error : expected 'var' (can't combine with 'onready')
